document_title: Mediastinal tumor: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
Nearly 40% of people with mediastinal tumors do not exhibit symptoms. The tumor is often discovered during a chest X-ray to diagnose another health condition. (3)
If the following symptoms appear, it is because the tumor is pressing on surrounding organs:
Cough; Short of breath; Chest pain; Nausea and vomiting; Fever; Chills; Night sweats; Hemoptisi; Hoarseness; Unintentional weight loss; Lymphadenopathy; Wheeze; Ptosis, small pupils, and other eye problems
Persistent coughing and coughing up blood are signs that the mediastinal tumor is compressing the lungs
